meanings.definition: A large, open-air venue for spectator sports or concerts, typically with a semicircular or circular design.
meanings.sent1: The community gathered at the amphitheater to watch the outdoor concert.
meanings.sent2: The famous singer performed at the amphitheater in front of a huge crowd.
meanings.sent3: The birds chirped happily in the amphitheater during the music show.
meanings.sent4: Her smile lit up the room like a spotlight in an amphitheater.
meanings.sent5: The colorful lights danced around the amphitheater, creating a magical atmosphere.

meanings.definition: A building with a round or oval performance area surrounded by rising tiers of seats.
meanings.sent1: The school play was held in the beautiful amphitheater with comfortable seating.
meanings.sent2: The ancient amphitheater was a remarkable architectural marvel of its time.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels decided to have a play in the tiny toy amphitheater.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like an amphitheater, filled with different levels of thoughts and ideas.
meanings.sent5: The echoes of laughter bounced off the walls of the amphitheater, creating a joyful atmosphere.
